definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: My husband knew how to work hard and smart.
sentences.chinese: 我的丈夫懂得如何苦干加巧干。

sentences.english: By working smart you can save a ridiculous amount of time you would have otherwise been spinning your wheels.
sentences.chinese: 巧干可以为你节省大量时间而不会让你忙的团团转。

sentences.english: Working smart means modeling other experienced people and doing your homework.
sentences.chinese: 巧干意味着效仿那些有经验的人来做好自己份内的事。

sentences.english: Work hard and smart, the emphasis will have hope.
sentences.chinese: 苦干加巧干，本科重点有希望。

definition: to work industriously/to get things done
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
you get what you put in/you reap what you sow
pinyin: yi1 fen1 geng1 yun2 , yi1 fen1 shou1 huo4

definition: to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
lit. the clumsy bird flies early (idiom); fig. to work hard to compensate for one's limited abilities
to become rich by one's own efforts/self-made
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
